verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 1:1
verses.text: The Epistle of Ignatius to the Trallians Shorter and Longer Versions  Ignatius, who is also called Theophorus, to the holy Church which is at Tralles, in Asia, beloved of God, the Father of Jesus Christ, elect, and worthy of God, possessing peace through the flesh, and blood, and passion of Jesus Christ, who is our hope, through our rising again to Him, which also I salute in its fulness, and in the apostolical character, and wish abundance of happiness.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 1:2
verses.text: Ignatius, who is also called Theophorus, to the holy Church which is at Tralles, beloved by God the Father, and Jesus Christ, elect, and worthy of God, possessing peace through the flesh and Spirit of Jesus Christ, who is our hope, in His passion by the cross and death, and in His resurrection, which also I salute in its fulness, and in the apostolical character, and wish abundance of happiness.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 1:3
verses.text: Chapter 1 — Acknowledgment of their excellence.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 1:4
verses.text: I know that ye possess an unblameable and sincere mind in patience, and that not only in present practice, but according to inherent nature, as Polybius your bishop has shown me, who has come to Smyrna by the will of God and Jesus Christ, and so sympathized in the joy which I, who am bound in Christ Jesus, possess, that I beheld your whole multitude in him.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 1:5
verses.text: Having therefore received through him the testimony of your good-will, according to God, I gloried to find you, as I knew you were, the followers of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 1:6
verses.text: I know that ye possess an unblameable and sincere mind in patience, and that not only for present use, but as a permanent possession, as Polybius your bishop has shown me, who has come to Smyrna by the will of God the Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ, His Son, with the co-operation of the Spirit, and so sympathized in the joy which I, who am bound in Christ Jesus, possess, that I beheld your whole multitude in Him.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 1:7
verses.text: Having therefore received through him the testimony of your good-will according to God, I gloried to find that you were the followers of Jesus Christ the Saviour.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 2:1
verses.text: Chapter 2 — Be subject to the bishop, etc.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 2:2
verses.text: For, since ye are subject to the bishop as to Jesus Christ, ye appear to me to live not after the manner of men, but according to Jesus Christ, who died for us, in order, by believing in His death, ye may escape from death.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 2:3
verses.text: It is therefore necessary that, as ye indeed do, so without the bishop ye should do nothing, but should also be subject to the presbytery, as to the apostle of Jesus Christ, who is our hope, in whom, if we live, we shall at last be found.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 2:4
verses.text: It is fitting also that the deacons, as being the ministers of the mysteries of Jesus Christ, should in every respect be pleasing to all.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 2:5
verses.text: For they are not ministers of meat and drink, but servants of the Church of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 2:6
verses.text: They are bound, therefore, to avoid all grounds of accusation against them, as they would do fire.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 2:7
verses.text: Be ye subject to the bishop as to the Lord, for "he watches for your souls, as one that shall give account to God".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 2:8
verses.text: Wherefore also, ye appear to me to live not after the manner of men, but according to Jesus Christ, who died for us, in order that, by believing in His death, ye may by baptism be made partakers of His resurrection.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 2:9
verses.text: It is therefore necessary, whatsoever things ye do, to do nothing without the bishop.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 2:10
verses.text: And be ye subject also to the presbytery, as to the apostles of Jesus Christ, who is our hope, in whom, if we live, we shall be found in Him.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 2:11
verses.text: It behoves you also, in every way, to please the deacons, who are ministers of the mysteries of Christ Jesus; for they are not ministers of meat and drink, but servants of the Church of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 2:12
verses.text: They are bound, therefore, to avoid all grounds of accusation against them, as they would a burning fire.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 2:13
verses.text: Let them, then, prove themselves to be such.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 3:1
verses.text: Chapter 3 — Honour the deacons, etc.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 3:2
verses.text: In like manner, let all reverence the deacons as an appointment of Jesus Christ, and the bishop as Jesus Christ, who is the Son of the Father, and the presbyters as the sanhedrim of God, and assembly of the apostles.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 3:3
verses.text: Apart from these, there is no Church.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 3:4
verses.text: Concerning all this, I am persuaded that ye are of the same opinion.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 3:5
verses.text: For I have received the manifestation of your love, and still have it with me, in your bishop, whose very appearance is highly instructive, and his meekness of itself a power; whom I imagine even the ungodly must reverence, seeing they are also pleased that I do not spare myself.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 3:6
verses.text: But shall I, when permitted to write on this point, reach such a height of self-esteem, that though being a condemned man, I should issue commands to you as if I were an apostle?  And do ye reverence them as Christ Jesus, of whose place they are the keepers, even as the bishop is the representative of the Father of all things, and the presbyters are the sanhedrim of God, and assembly of the apostles of Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 3:7
verses.text: Apart from these there is no elect Church, no congregation of holy ones, no assembly of saints.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 3:8
verses.text: I am persuaded that ye also are of this opinion.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 3:9
verses.text: For I have received the manifestation of your love, and still have it with me, in your bishop, whose very appearance is highly instructive, and his meekness of itself a power; whom I imagine even the ungodly must reverence.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 3:10
verses.text: Loving you as I do, I avoid writing in any severer strain to you, that I may not seem harsh to any, or wanting in tenderness.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 3:11
verses.text: I am indeed bound for the sake of Christ, but I am not yet worthy of Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 3:12
verses.text: But when I am perfected, perhaps I shall then become so.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 3:13
verses.text: I do not issue orders like an apostle.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 4:1
verses.text: Chapter 4 — I have need of humility.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 4:2
verses.text: I have great knowledge in God, but I restrain myself, lest, I should perish through boasting.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 4:3
verses.text: For now it is needful for me to be the more fearful; and not give heed to those that puff me up.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 4:4
verses.text: For they that speak to me in the way of commendation scourge me.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 4:5
verses.text: For I do indeed desire to suffer, but I know not if I be worthy to do so.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 4:6
verses.text: For this longing, though it is not manifest to many, all the more vehemently assails me.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 4:7
verses.text: I therefore have need of meekness, by which the prince of this world is brought to nought.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 4:8
verses.text: But I measure myself, that I may not perish through boasting: but it is good to glory in the Lord.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 4:9
verses.text: And even though I were established in things pertaining to God, yet then would it befit me to be the more fearful, and not give heed to those that vainly puff me up.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 4:10
verses.text: For those that commend me scourge me.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 4:11
verses.text: I do indeed desire to suffer, but I know not if I be worthy to do so.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 4:12
verses.text: For the envy of the wicked one is not visible to many, but it wars against me.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 4:13
verses.text: I therefore have need of meekness, by which the devil, the prince of this world, is brought to nought.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 5:1
verses.text: Chapter 5 — I will not teach you profound doctrines.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 5:2
verses.text: Am I not able to write to you of heavenly things? But I fear to do so, lest I should inflict injury on you who are but babes in Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 5:3
verses.text: Pardon me in this respect, lest, as not being able to receive such doctrines, ye should be strangled by them.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 5:4
verses.text: For even I, though I am bound for Christ, yet am not on that account able to understand heavenly things, and the places of the angels, and their gatherings under their respective princes, things visible and invisible.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 5:5
verses.text: Without reference to such abstruse subjects, I am still but a learner in other respects; for many things are wanting to us, that we come not short of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 5:6
verses.text: For might not I write to you things more full of mystery? But I fear to do so, lest I should inflict injury on you who are but babes in Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 5:7
verses.text: Pardon me in this respect, lest, as not being able to receive their weighty import, ye should be strangled by them.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 5:8
verses.text: For even I, though I am bound for Christ, and am able to understand heavenly things, the angelic orders, and the different sorts of angels and hosts, the distinctions between powers and dominions, and the diversities between thrones and authorities, the mightiness of the aeons, and the pre-eminence of the cherubim and seraphim, the sublimity of the spirit, the kingdom of the Lord, and above all, the incomparable majesty of Almighty God—though I am acquainted with these things, yet am I not therefore by any means perfect; nor am I such a disciple as Paul or Peter.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 5:9
verses.text: For many things are yet wanting to me, that I may not fall short of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 6:1
verses.text: Chapter 6 — Abstain from the poison of heretics.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 6:2
verses.text: I therefore, yet not I, but the love of Jesus Christ, entreat you that ye use Christian nourishment only, and abstain from herbage of a different kind; I mean heresy.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 6:3
verses.text: For those that are given to this mix up Jesus Christ with their own poison, speaking things which are unworthy of credit, like those who administer a deadly drug in sweet wine, which he who is ignorant of does greedily take, with a fatal pleasure leading to his own death.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 6:4
verses.text: I therefore, yet not I, out the love of Jesus Christ, "entreat you that ye all speak the same thing, and that there be no divisions among you; but that ye be perfectly joined together in the same mind, and in the same judgment".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 6:5
verses.text: For there are some vain talkers and deceivers, not Christians, but Christ-betrayers, bearing about the name of Christ in deceit, and "corrupting the word" of the Gospel; while they intermix the poison of their deceit with their persuasive talk, as if they mingled aconite with sweet wine, that so he who drinks, being deceived in his taste by the very great sweetness of the draught, may incautiously meet with his death.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 6:6
verses.text: One of the ancients gives us this advice, "Let no man be called good who mixes good with evil".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 6:7
verses.text: For they speak of Christ, not that they may preach Christ, but that they may reject Christ; and they speak of the law, not that they may establish the law, but that they may proclaim things contrary to it.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 6:8
verses.text: For they alienate Christ from the Father, and the law from Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 6:9
verses.text: They also calumniate His being born of the Virgin; they are ashamed of His cross; they deny His passion; and they do not believe His resurrection.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 6:10
verses.text: They introduce God as a Being unknown; they suppose Christ to be unbegotten; and as to the Spirit, they do not admit that He exists.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 6:11
verses.text: Some of them say that the Son is a mere man, and that the Father, Son, and Holy Spirit are but the same person, and that the creation is the work of God, not by Christ, but by some other strange power.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 7:1
verses.text: Chapter 7 — The same continued.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 7:2
verses.text: Be on your guard, therefore, against such persons.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 7:3
verses.text: And this will be the case with you if you are not puffed up, and continue in intimate union with Jesus Christ our God, and the bishop, and the enactments of the apostles.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 7:4
verses.text: He that is within the altar is pure, but he that is without is not pure; that is, he who does anything apart from the bishop, and presbytery, and deacons, such a man is not pure in his conscience.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 7:5
verses.text: Be on your guard, therefore, against such persons, that ye admit not of a snare for your own souls.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 7:6
verses.text: And act so that your life shall be without offence to all men, lest ye become as "a snare upon a watch-tower, and as a net which is spread out".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 7:7
verses.text: For "he that does not heal himself in his own works, is the brother of him that destroys himself".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 7:8
verses.text: If, therefore, ye also put away conceit, arrogance, disdain, and haughtiness, it will be your privilege to be inseparably united to God, for "He is nigh unto those that fear Him".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 7:9
verses.text: And says He, "Upon whom will I look, but upon him that is humble and quiet, and that trembles at my words?" And do ye also reverence your bishop as Christ Himself, according as the blessed apostles have enjoined you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 7:10
verses.text: He that is within the altar is pure, wherefore also he is obedient to the bishop and presbyters: but he that is without is one that does anything apart from the bishop, the presbyters, and the deacons.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 7:11
verses.text: Such a person is defiled in his conscience, and is worse than an infidel.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 7:12
verses.text: For what is the bishop but one who beyond all others possesses all power and authority, so far as it is possible for a man to possess it, who according to his ability has been made an imitator of the Christ of God? And what is the presbytery but a sacred assembly, the counsellors and assessors of the bishop? And what are the deacons but imitators of the angelic powers, fulfilling a pure and blameless ministry unto him, as the holy Stephen did to the blessed James, Timothy and Linus to Paul, Anencletus and Clement to Peter? He, therefore, that will not yield obedience to such, must needs be one utterly without God, an impious man who despises Christ, and depreciates His appointments.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 8:1
verses.text: Chapter 8 — Be on your guard against the snares of the devil.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 8:2
verses.text: Not that I know there is anything of this kind among you; but I put you on your guard, inasmuch as I love you greatly, and foresee the snares of the devil.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 8:3
verses.text: Wherefore, clothing yourselves with meekness, be ye renewed in faith, that is the flesh of the Lord, and in love, that is the blood of Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 8:4
verses.text: Let no one of you cherish any grudge against his neighbour.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 8:5
verses.text: Give no occasion to the Gentiles, lest by means of a few foolish men the whole multitude of those that believe in God be evil spoken of.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 8:6
verses.text: For, "Woe to him by whose vanity my name is blasphemed among any".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 8:7
verses.text: Now I write these things unto you, not that I know there are any such persons among you; nay, indeed I hope that God will never permit any such report to reach my ears, He "who spared not His Son for the sake of His holy Church".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 8:8
verses.text: But foreseeing the snares of the wicked one, I arm you beforehand by my admonitions, as my beloved and faithful children in Christ, furnishing you with the means of protection against the deadly disease of unruly men, by which do ye flee from the disease referred to by the good-will of Christ our Lord.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 8:9
verses.text: Do ye therefore, clothing yourselves with meekness, become the imitators of His sufferings, and of His love, wherewith He loved us when He gave Himself a ransom for us, that He might cleanse us by His blood from our old ungodliness, and bestow life on us when we were almost on the point of perishing through the depravity that was in us.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 8:10
verses.text: Let no one of you, therefore, cherish any grudge against his neighbour.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 8:11
verses.text: For says our Lord, "Forgive, and it shall be forgiven unto you".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 8:12
verses.text: Give no occasion to the Gentiles, lest "by means of a few foolish men the word and doctrine of Christ be blasphemed".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 8:13
verses.text: For says the prophet, as in the person of God, "Woe to him by whom my name is blasphemed among the Gentiles".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 9:1
verses.text: Chapter 9 — Reference to the history of Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 9:2
verses.text: Stop your ears, therefore, when any one speaks to you at variance with Jesus Christ, who was descended from David, and was also of Mary; who was truly born, and did eat and drink.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 9:3
verses.text: He was truly persecuted under Pontius Pilate; He was truly crucified, and truly died, in the sight of beings in heaven, and on earth, and under the earth.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 9:4
verses.text: He was also truly raised from the dead, His Father quickening Him, even as after the same manner His Father will so raise up us who believe in Him by Christ Jesus, apart from whom we do not possess the true life.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 9:5
verses.text: Stop your ears, therefore, when any one speaks to you at variance with Jesus Christ, the Son of God, who was descended from David, and was also of Mary; who was truly begotten of God and of the Virgin, but not after the same manner.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 9:6
verses.text: For indeed God and man are not the same.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 9:7
verses.text: He truly assumed a body; for "the Word was made flesh," and lived upon earth without sin.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 9:8
verses.text: For says He, "Which of you convicteth me of sin?" He did in reality both eat and drink.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 9:9
verses.text: He was crucified and died under Pontius Pilate.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 9:10
verses.text: He really, and not merely in appearance, was crucified, and died, in the sight of beings in heaven, and on earth, and under the earth.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 9:11
verses.text: By those in heaven I mean such as are possessed of incorporeal natures; by those on earth, the Jews and Romans, and such persons as were present at that time when the Lord was crucified; and by those under the earth, the multitude that arose along with the Lord.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 9:12
verses.text: For says the Scripture, "Many bodies of the saints that slept arose," their graves being opened.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 9:13
verses.text: He descended, indeed, into Hades alone, but He arose accompanied by a multitude; and rent asunder that means of separation which had existed from the beginning of the world, and cast down its partition-wall.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 9:14
verses.text: He also rose again in three days, the Father raising Him up; and after spending forty days with the apostles, He was received up to the Father, and "sat down at His right hand, expecting till His enemies are placed under His feet".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 9:15
verses.text: On the day of the preparation, then, at the third hour, He received the sentence from Pilate, the Father permitting that to happen; at the sixth hour He was crucified; at the ninth hour He gave up the ghost; and before sunset He was buried.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 9:16
verses.text: During the Sabbath He continued under the earth in the tomb in which Joseph of Arimathaea had laid Him.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 9:17
verses.text: At the dawning of the Lord's day He arose from the dead, according to what was spoken by Himself, "As Jonah was three days and three nights in the whale's belly, so shall the Son of man also be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 9:18
verses.text: The day of the preparation, then, comprises the passion; the Sabbath embraces the burial; the Lord's Day contains the resurrection.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 10:1
verses.text: Chapter 10 — The reality of Christ's passion.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 10:2
verses.text: But if, as some that are without God, that is, the unbelieving, say, that He only seemed to suffer (they themselves only seeming to exist), then why am I in bonds? Why do I long to be exposed to the wild beasts? Do I therefore die in vain? Am I not then guilty of falsehood against the cross of the Lord?  But if, as some that are without God, that is, the unbelieving, say, He became man in appearance only, that He did not in reality take unto Him a body, that He died in appearance merely, and did not in very deed suffer, then for what reason am I now in bonds, and long to be exposed to the wild beasts? In such a case, I die in vain, and am guilty of falsehood against the cross of the Lord.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 10:3
verses.text: Then also does the prophet in vain declare, "They shall look on Him whom they have pierced, and mourn over themselves as over one beloved".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 10:4
verses.text: These men, therefore, are not less unbelievers than were those that crucified Him.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 10:5
verses.text: But as for me, I do not place my hopes in one who died for me in appearance, but in reality.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 10:6
verses.text: For that which is false is quite abhorrent to the truth.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 10:7
verses.text: Mary then did truly conceive a body which had God inhabiting it.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 10:8
verses.text: And God the Word was truly born of the Virgin, having clothed Himself with a body of like passions with our own.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 10:9
verses.text: He who forms all men in the womb, was Himself really in the womb, and made for Himself a body of the seed of the Virgin, but without any intercourse of man.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 10:10
verses.text: He was carried in the womb, even as we are, for the usual period of time; and was really born, as we also are; and was in reality nourished with milk, and partook of common meat and drink, even as we do.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 10:11
verses.text: And when He had lived among men for thirty years, He was baptized by John, really and not in appearance; and when He had preached the Gospel three years, and done signs and wonders, He who was Himself the Judge was judged by the Jews, falsely so called, and by Pilate the governor; was scourged, was smitten on the cheek, was spit upon; He wore a crown of thorns and a purple robe; He was condemned: He was crucified in reality, and not in appearance, not in imagination, not in deceit.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 10:12
verses.text: He really died, and was buried, and rose from the dead, even as He prayed in a certain place, saying, "But do Thou, O Lord, raise me up again, and I shall recompense them".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 10:13
verses.text: And the Father, who always hears Him, answered and said, "Arise, O God, and judge the earth; for Thou shall receive all the heathen for Thine inheritance".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 10:14
verses.text: The Father, therefore, who raised Him up, will also raise us up through Him, apart from whom no one will attain to true life.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 10:15
verses.text: For says He, "I am the life; he that believeth in me, even though he die, shall live: and every one that liveth and believeth in me, even though he die, shall live for ever".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 10:16
verses.text: Do ye therefore flee from these ungodly heresies; for they are the inventions of the devil, that serpent who was the author of evil, and who by means of the woman deceived Adam, the father of our race.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 11:1
verses.text: Chapter 11 — Avoid the deadly errors of the Docetae.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 11:2
verses.text: Flee, therefore, those evil offshoots of Satan, which produce death-bearing fruit, whereof if any one tastes, he instantly dies.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 11:3
verses.text: For these men are not the planting of the Father.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 11:4
verses.text: For if they were, they would appear as branches of the cross, and their fruit would be incorruptible.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 11:5
verses.text: By it He calls you through His passion, as being His members.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 11:6
verses.text: The head, therefore, cannot be born by itself, without its members; God, who is the Saviour Himself, having promised their union.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 11:7
verses.text: Do ye also avoid those wicked offshoots of his, Simon his firstborn son, and Menander, and Basilides, and all his wicked mob of followers, the worshippers of a man, whom also the prophet Jeremiah pronounces accursed.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 11:8
verses.text: Flee also the impure Nicolaitanes, falsely so called, who are lovers of pleasure, and given to calumnious speeches.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 11:9
verses.text: Avoid also the children of the evil one, Theodotus and Cleobulus, who produce death-bearing fruit, whereof if any one tastes, he instantly dies, and that not a mere temporary death, but one that shall endure for ever.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 11:10
verses.text: These men are not the planting of the Father, but are an accursed brood.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 11:11
verses.text: And says the Lord, "Let every plant which my heavenly Father has not planted be rooted up".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 11:12
verses.text: For if they had been branches of the Father, they would not have been "enemies of the cross of Christ," but rather of those who "killed the Lord of glory".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 11:13
verses.text: But now, by denying the cross, and being ashamed of the passion, they cover the transgression of the Jews, those fighters against God, those murderers of the Lord; for it were too little to style them merely murderers of the prophets.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 11:14
verses.text: But Christ invites you to share in His immortality, by His passion and resurrection, inasmuch as ye are His members.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 12:1
verses.text: Chapter 12 — Continue in unity and love.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 12:2
verses.text: I salute you from Smyrna, together with the Churches of God which are with me, who have refreshed me in all things, both in the flesh and in the spirit.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 12:3
verses.text: My bonds, which I carry about with me for the sake of Jesus Christ (praying that I may attain to God), exhort you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 12:4
verses.text: Continue in harmony among yourselves, and in prayer with one another; for it becomes every one of you, and especially the presbyters, to refresh the bishop, to the honour of the Father, of Jesus Christ, and of the apostles.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 12:5
verses.text: I entreat you in love to hear me, that I may not, by having written, be a testimony against you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 12:6
verses.text: And do ye also pray for me, who have need of your love, along with the mercy of God, that I may be worthy of the lot for which I am destined, and that I may not be found reprobate.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 12:7
verses.text: I salute you from Smyrna, together with the Churches of God which are with me, whose rulers have refreshed me in every respect, both in the flesh and in the spirit.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 12:8
verses.text: My bonds, which I carry about with me for the sake of Jesus Christ (praying that I may attain to God), exhort you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 12:9
verses.text: Continue in harmony among yourselves, and in supplication; for it becomes every one of you, and especially the presbyters, to refresh the bishop, to the honour of the Father, and to the honour of Jesus Christ and of the apostles.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 12:10
verses.text: I entreat you in love to hear me, that I may not, by having thus written, be a testimony against you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 12:11
verses.text: And do ye also pray for me, who have need of your love, along with the mercy of God, that I may be thought worthy to attain the lot for which I am now designed, and that I may not be found reprobate.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 13:1
verses.text: Chapter 13 — Conclusion.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 13:2
verses.text: The love of the Smyrnaeans and Ephesians salutes you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 13:3
verses.text: Remember in your prayers the Church which is in Syria, from which also I am not worthy to receive my appellation, being the last of them.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 13:4
verses.text: Fare ye well in Jesus Christ, while ye continue subject to the bishop, as to the command of God, and in like manner to the presbytery.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 13:5
verses.text: And do ye, every man, love one another with an undivided heart.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 13:6
verses.text: Let my spirit be sanctified by yours, not only now, but also when I shall attain to God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 13:7
verses.text: For I am as yet exposed to danger.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 13:8
verses.text: But the Father is faithful in Jesus Christ to fulfil both mine and your petitions: in whom may ye be found unblameable.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 13:9
verses.text: The love of the Smyrnaeans and Ephesians salutes you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 13:10
verses.text: Remember our Church which is in Syria, from which I am not worthy to receive my appellation, being the last of those of that place.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 13:11
verses.text: Fare ye well in the Lord Jesus Christ, while ye continue subject to the bishop, and in like manner to the presbyters and to the deacons.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 13:12
verses.text: And do ye, every man, love one another with an undivided heart.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 13:13
verses.text: My spirit salutes you, not only now, but also when I shall have attained to God; for I am as yet exposed to danger.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 13:14
verses.text: But the Father of Jesus Christ is faithful to fulfil both mine and your petitions: in whom may we be found without spot.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Trallians 13:15
verses.text: May I have joy of you in the Lord.
